page.title: 01Great Ayton village.
page.content: Great Ayton is a pretty village in North Yorkshire at the foot of the Cleveland Hills.The two main hills are called{Roseberry Topping}and {Larners Hill}which has an obelisk on top,in memory of{Captain Cook. There is a museum in the village which was where Cook went to school. The{River Leven}runs through the village.There are lots of ducks on the river.The most picturesque part of the river is bordered by the Low Green which is like a park.There has been a settlement here for about 900 years and Great Ayton is mentioned in the{Domesday Book}which was finished in 1084.The main road runs through the village.there is a large stone bridge which crosses over the river and a good collection of shops. Most are to be found facing the High Green.Many summer visitors come to Great Ayton.
